messages.message:
Hi Team,
I'm unable to use the crafting sandbox for my local IDE. I'm encountering an "Unauthenticated" error when I try to grant permission.
I am attaching the screen recording for your reference.
Could someone please assist me with this?
Thanks!

Tried my side, worked well for me
Tried it with version `1.7.0` as well as `1.8.1`
@sitaram are you available for a short call? We can try to resolve this issue.

My executable is `arm64` and hence the version is `1.8.3` while SItaram's executable is `amd64` (`x86_64`) hence the version is `1.8.1`
For my arch, version `1.8.1` does not exist.

I believe the issue is with the ARM binary.
cc @sitaram

I notice in the video that the link it redirects to is incorrect, did you follow the instructions here (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/2107736112/Setting+Up+Your+Crafting+Environment#Configure-Your-Environment)?

You need to run/add to zshrc `export CRAFTING_SANDBOX_SERVER_URL=https://instabase.sandboxes.site` and then try cs login. Did that not work?

@abhishekk try this suggestion from Carfting team

——

Please config the server url to the instabase site , the config operation only needs to be executed once.
```cs config set server_url https://instabase.sandboxes.site
# and then
cs login```
Yup, its the same one! Setting in as an env var also does the same.
I stepped out for evening walk. Once back, I'll check and inform the status on the thread.

Thanks @sitaram, @Vasu
Login was successful after this step.
